intro: Exostema ixoroides subsp. maestrense, commonly known as the Maestrense Exostema, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, moist forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
